metadata.title: CVE-2021-3981 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - low.
metadata.description: grub2: Incorrect permission in grub.cfg allow unprivileged user to read the file content

notes.note: mdeslaur> I'm not sure what this CVE is about. Our grub-mkconfig script only makes grub.cfg world-readable if there is no password in it. See also: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/grub2/+bug/248843

criterions.comment: grub2 package in hirsute is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it.
